alert.note: Alert for Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 2:25AM CDT until May 09 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron and Willacy. * WHEN...Until 300 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 225 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rio Hondo, Arroyo City, Brownsville, Rio Hondo High School, Lozano, Rio Hondo Elementary School, Rio Hondo Junior High School, Rio Hondo City Hall, La Tina, Monte Grande, Las Yescas, Las Yescas Elementary School, Montgomery Reservoir, Villa Del Sol, Abbott Reservoir and Mccloud Hood Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
